snippet: President Obama’s campaign will use the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that seems to be benefiting from clashes on birth control and abortion.
abstract: Pres Obama's re-election campaign has begun an intensified effort to build support among women, using the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that already appears to be benefiting from partisan clashes over birth control and abortion; will send mailings to one million women in more than a dozen battleground states, alongside efforts to organize phone banks, campus activities and media events; women's vote, which made up 53 percent of the electorate in 2008, is seen as essential to Pres Obama's re-election prospects.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s campaign will use the debate over the new health care law to amplify an appeal that seems to be benefiting from clashes on birth control and abortion.

headline.main: Obama Plans Big Effort to Build Support Among Women
headline.print_headline: Obama Campaign Plans Big Effort to Court Women

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
